message: http://us.pycon.org/2011/schedule/
Sweet. I am so excited for this.
@closedBracket we are working out the best way to re-introduce it. i agree that it makes it easy to compare, but it had its pitfalls.
Yeah, what are they trying to do making the damned conference so good?
Whoever had the star idea deserves a star.
CAN'T WAIT!
OMG, who lends me a time machine??
See also the 10 conferences of PyCon: http://news.ycombinator.com/item?id=2272943
jesus, like half these slots I have multiples I *have* to attend
@holdenweb and that doesn't account for the fact that I'm going to miss half of them for hallway track anyways
This is awesome. I look forward to this more than to my own wedding.
yeah it was, intersting
Without offending anyone, I really liked the on-hover detail-loading schedule we had last year. It made it really fast to compare talks. Any thoughts on why it was nixed?
I'm going to have to make huge use of the video uploads since I'm not good at cloning.
@alex Talks are what videos are for! :-)
I just hope that one of @VanL announcements for Today is availability of cloning machines on-site... I want to be in all four rooms all the time ;-)
@juandg use multiprocessing
Arg I'm gonna miss Hettinger #2. I swore I'd never miss a Hettinger again :^S
@brosner Also having arrows in the lightbox (up, down, left, right) to proceed to next talk in the grid instead of switching back.
@juandg TARDIS...
@brosner I am a fan of having a click-spot (say top right corner) to click to get a modal window (ala lightbox). It is a much better interaction model.
@brosner I specked it out, and started implementing it, but the old system was too tied to old, now defunct JS framework.
I'm going to need to multi-thread myself and hit up all of these talks.
You can put javascript:$($($($('.bookmark')).parent()).parent()).empty() in your location bar after you've bookmarked the talks you want to see to get an overview of only talks you are interested in
@glenbot If your body is running CPython, you should consider multiprocessing, so the GIL won't be an issue.
Yeah, that's obvious :)
http://us.pycon.org/2011/blog/2011/03/07/pycon-program-guide-your-ios-and-android-devices/

That's right folks, the entire program guide with all tutorials, talks, sponsors, expo hall, floorplans, custom personal schedule, twitter integration, and more right on your Apple or Android device (including Snow Leopard). Once its on your device, no network required.
Very nice!
I'm a fan. Wish it had the tracks/rooms laid out like the official schedule site, but it at least lists the room in the metadata which is better than nothing.
We are in the future!
This is so awesome.  Every day I regret getting my Palm Pre more and more.  Soon Android, soon, you and I will be together!  My two year contract is ending soon, but not soon enough.
